page.title: 06The Forester's Talk:N.Silton
page.content: Timber is thinned by a 4 wheel drive tractor and winch. The Forestry Commission permits Silton Forest to be used for walking, orienteering,car rallying,motor cycle trials,shooting,foxhunting,horse riding and picnics. The spruce is used for pulping to make paper;scots pine thinnings are used for fencing stakes and bigger saw logs are used for construction work. Patrols go round the forest every 14 days to spot fires.They rely on the public and the fire brigade for help too.A special type of foam which is cheap and easy to use has been developed to help in fire fighting.It forms a barrier to the flames. All the men are equipped properly with helmets,earmuffs,visors,leggings,pads and gloves.The men are working nights to cope with the demand for timber.
